Problem:"}]," The paper addresses Fishkin's \"deliberative trilemma\"—the inherent tension between achieving broad participation, political equality, and meaningful deliberation simultaneously in democratic processes."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-1",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Proposed Solution:"}]," The use of AI-mediated deliberation, exemplified by the \"Habermas Machine\" (HM), an LLM-based system designed to find common ground among diverse viewpoints."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-2",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Habermas Machine (HM) Architecture:"}],"\n",["$","ul","ul-0",{"children":["\n",["$","li","li-0",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Simulated Election:"}]," The HM generates a group statement by simulating an election."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-1",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Generative Model:"}]," Proposes a large set of candidate group statements based on participant inputs."]}],"\n","$L17","\n","$L18","\n","$L19","\n"]}],"\n"]}],"\n","$L1a","\n","$L1b","\n","$L1c","\n"]}]]}]]}]

16:["$","div","3",{"className":"ArticlePreview_ArticlePreview__59E_4","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"ArticlePreview_title__Snpua","children":["$","$L10",null,{"href":"https://localghost.dev/blog/this-website-is-for-humans/","target":"_blank","children":"This website is for humans - localghost"}]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"ArticlePreview_tags__y8wnE","children":[["$","$L10","0",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/generative%20ai","children":"generative ai"}],["$","$L10","1",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/ai","children":"ai"}],["$","$L10","2",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/content%20creation","children":"content creation"}],["$","$L10","3",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/human-computer%20interaction","children":"human-computer interaction"}],["$","$L10","4",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/google%20zero","children":"google zero"}],["$","$L10","5",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/search%20engines","children":"search engines"}],["$","$L10","6",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/seo","children":"seo"}],["$","$L10","7",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/website%20traffic","children":"website traffic"}],["$","$L10","8",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/author%20discoverability","children":"author discoverability"}],["$","$L10","9",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/monetization","children":"monetization"}],["$","$L10","10",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/ad%20impressions","children":"ad impressions"}],["$","$L10","11",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/authorial%20voice","children":"authorial voice"}],["$","$L10","12",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/nuance","children":"nuance"}],["$","$L10","13",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/llms","children":"llms"}],["$","$L10","14",{"className":"ArticlePreview_tag___oIyn","href":"/tag/intellectual%20property","children":"intellectual property"}]]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"ArticlePreview_summary__Zyb4E","children":[["$","ul","ul-0",{"children":["\n",["$","li","li-0",{"children":"Critiques generative AI as a derivative process that synthesizes human-created work, leading to a loss of credibility and nuance."}],"\n",["$","li","li-1",{"children":"Contrasts AI-generated content with human-authored content, emphasizing the value of the latter's reliability, testing, and authorial voice."}],"\n",["$","li","li-2",{"children":"Raises the \"Google Zero\" concern: the potential for AI search summaries to eliminate referral traffic to original websites."}],"\n",["$","li","li-3",{"children":"Argues that website traffic is essential for author discoverability, professional opportunities, and monetization through ad impressions."}],"\n",["$","li","li-4",{"children":"States the author's content is created for human engagement and the sharing of nuanced experiences, which AI summarization strips away."}],"\n",["$","li","li-5",{"children":"Explicitly disallows LLMs from processing the website's content."}],"\n"]}]]}]]}]
17:["$","li","li-2",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Personalized Reward Model (PRM):"}]," Predicts how each participant would rank the candidate statements."]}]
18:["$","li","li-3",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Aggregation Mechanism:"}]," Uses a social choice function (e.g., Schulze method) to aggregate the predicted rankings and select a winning statement."]}]
19:["$","li","li-4",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Iterative Process:"}]," Supports multiple rounds of participant critique and AI-driven revision to refine the outcome."]}]
1a:["$","li","li-3",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Key Findings (from Tessler, Bakker, et al., 2024):"}],"\n",["$","ul","ul-0",{"children":["\n",["$","li","li-0",{"children":"The HM outperformed human mediators in generating common ground statements that participants endorsed."}],"\n",["$","li","li-1",{"children":"The system's scalability and efficiency are its key advantages over human mediation."}],"\n",["$","li","li-2",{"children":"Iterative rounds of critique and revision led to higher participant approval."}],"\n",["$","li","li-3",{"children":"The process was found to be fair in representing majority/minority viewpoints, though it could overweight minority critiques in revision rounds."}],"\n"]}],"\n"]}]
1b:["$","li","li-4",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Addressing the Trilemma:"}],"\n",["$","ul","ul-0",{"children":["\n",["$","li","li-0",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Equality (Fairness):"}]," Fairness is addressed through architectural design (fair aggregation, ranking, and generation) and requires continuous monitoring with interpretability tools to prevent algorithmic bias."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-1",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Participation (Scalability):"}]," AI mediation can scale to large groups, but this creates a \"scalable oversight\" problem. Hierarchical aggregation (small groups deliberating, then aggregating group outputs) is proposed as a transparent and verifiable solution."]}],"\n",["$","li","li-2",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Deliberation (Quality):"}]," AI can enhance deliberative quality by acting as an \"expert on tap,\" providing trustworthy information, or serving as a deliberative coach for individuals. This requires careful design to avoid manipulation and ensure AI factuality."]}],"\n"]}],"\n"]}]
1c:["$","li","li-5",{"children":[["$","strong","strong-0",{"children":"Limitations & Future Directions:"}],"\n",["$","ul","ul-0",{"children":["\n",["$","li","li-0",{"children":"AI-mediated caucus deliberation lacks the social-relational dynamics (e.g., trust, empathy) of face-to-face interaction and must overcome potential \"algorithmic aversion.\""}],"\n",["$","li","li-1",{"children":"The system assumes good-faith participation; strategic misrepresentation of preferences is an open research problem."}],"\n",["$","li","li-2",{"children":"Potential applications range from informal online forums (e.g., X's Community Notes) to formal processes like scaling deliberative polls and facilitating multilateral negotiations."}],"\n"]}],"\n"]}]
